isis.stitle: Electrical System Troubleshooting Guide - 3300 Model - BATTERY, CHARGING AND CRANKING SYSTEMS - CHARGING - CHARGING CIRCUITS

svcprocinfo.para: For a complete discussion on operating principles for alternators, refer to Group 08 Electrical in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the specific alternator being serviced.

svcsubproc.title: International Engines
svcsubproc.para: When the vehicle is running, the alternator supplies power through the alternator or (BAT) terminal, and circuit K2A to a splice. From the splice, current flows through a fusible link to the crank motor solenoid battery stud. From this stud, current flows to the batteries through the positive battery cable. Power is also applied to fuse block (1011) through fusible links K14V-FL and K14W-FL.
The alternator is grounded through the (GRD) terminal and circuit K2-G to the engine block ground (G).
